column2: sometimes, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It knocked the bv out apparently, or almost, after five days.  But as I take an immune suppressant drug, when I took that, the infection recurred.Took two more courses, skipping the immune suppressing drug for many weeks, but it still gradually recurred.Had raging yeast infection after a couple of days each time.The medication stings upon application though that gradually subsides.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 34 weeks pregnant and my OB gave me this medication to treat a vaginal bacteria infection. This medication caused me diarrhea and stomach cramps.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I think it made my nose bleed. I had to go to the emergence room to get it to stop. And it gave me a yeast infection...WTF  We need a better cure for this stuff. SMH

column2: Stana, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Took this medication and it gave me a terrible yeast infection from hell, even though I took probiotics as instructed.  I don't know if there are other options for treating BV, but if I ever get it again I will DEFINITELY ask for something else!

column2: TexanGirl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Used MetroGel for 5 days after being diagnosed with BV. I had one spell of diarrhea and the cottage cheese discharge. However, the drug worked.

column2: girlygirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Thank goodness for webMD. I started using this medication 4 days ago for BV and I noticed a cottage cheesey, very strange discharge. Wondering if this was normal, I came here searching for answers. This medication caused diarrhea for the first day but I am feeling way better. I tried oral contraceptives and they didn't work so this gel has been a life saver. They should really inform the patient about the strange discharge before use!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Ok so I go in to the doctor because I thought I had a yeast infection that otc meds wouldnt cure. The doctor says I have BV and I have never heard of this condition nor have I had problems with my lady parts. The medicine was easy to use, but the side effects!!!! Lawd have mercy!!!!! 1. Stomach cramps!!! 2. Dizziness 3. Nasty cottage cheesy discharge. I had to do more looking on the internet to find out what was going on. The discharge is the medicine getting the nasty stuff out. I have been off this med for 5 days and so far so good.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 26 weeks pregnant and started taking the suppositories once a night for 5 nights. Everything went fine except for the side effects: cramping, diarrhea, and the discharge. I now have a yeast infection and I'm treating it with OTC medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: On Day 2 of treatment, got a yeast infection.  On Day 4 of treatment, severe cramping, uncontrollable diarrhia, nausea, bloating.  The diarrhia was the worst--I stopped taking this drug after 4 days.  Side effects were too severe.

column2: hopelessly desperate, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: the side effects where mild, but I still Have BV. never got rid of it. hopelessly desperate for new medication that will work.

column2: rosegirl22, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Doc gave me metrogel vaginal gel after a routine pap showed low levels of Gardnerella.  I was having no symptoms, but decided to take metrogel as she prescribed.  What a nightmare! Day 3 I ended up in the ER with syncope (fainting/blackouts), low blood pressure 83/74), cramping, and headache, all side-effects of metro-gel.  Doc said many people have a bad reaction to Flagyl (an ingredient in metro-gel).  I suggest trying ANY other remedy, either natural or prescribed before taking this.  It was just horrible, messy, and caused a yeast infection to top it all off.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my 3rd day and it was very easy to use.  I didnt have much leakage or anything.  But day 2 i started noticing cottage like cheese discharge and itcing on mybody.  So it gave me a yeast infection.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This was so easy to use and only dripped out a little bit early in the day when I got up. I took the oral form of the antibiotic first and it made me severely sick. I was so much happier using the gel. I had no side affects while taking it, the only downside was that it gave me a yeast infection. It was still way better than the side effects of the oral drug! I only had to take this for 5 days which is another reason that this was better than the oral med.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had no side effects at all. I used it before I went to bed and found that it wasn't messy at all if you apply it correctly. I am BV free :)

column2: afiyaa, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: im 6 weeks pregnant and i have BV. my doctor prescribed this for me and said it would get rid of it. so far so good. no side effects or irritations but i hope it does not harm my baby. . .

column2: Lock1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had absolutely NO side effects. I was prescribed Cipro originally and it failed to kill the bacteria. This is the best stuff.

column2: tee, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: none

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have one day of treatment left. I think it has cleared the infection, but I am having side effects such as upset stomach and cramping, diarrhea and Nausea. I hope these go away quickly after the treatment is done.

column2: worried, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was 20 weeks pregnant when my GYN prescriped MetroGel because of an infection. I wish there was more information about the risk to the fetus while using this medication. The pamphlet that came with the medicine offered no information of prenatal side affects and most websites advisednot to use the product during pregnany. I hope the doctor knew what she was doing. Overall the gel is odorless and easy to insert. It is clear so it is not staining my under garments

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The gel worked but it was painful, however i am free of BV.

column2: Andrea2613, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am extremely satisfied with the effectiveness of this medication.  The only problems I encountered were headache, nausea, and diarrhea which, honestly, were worth it especially if it meant getting rid of the problem.  After the first dose, I noticed that the odor was gone the following morning. This had been an on-going problem since last summer and I was getting frustrated because every test was normal.  I know my body and was persistent in finding out what was wrong.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Metrogel is very messy and after you insert the gel (vaginally) even if you lie down immediately after (i.e. go to sleep for the night) it will ooze out all day once you do eventually get up. It seemed to thin to actually stay in place. It never cleared up my BV and after a week of messy misery I had to go on another drug to clear the infection. Clindamycin is MUCH better!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It seems to be working well.  But I have a little stinging and irritation still.
